data.title: The Worshipful Company of Nurses
data.text:
10

News

Freedom and Livery ceremonies of the Worshipful Company of Nurses were held in the Court Room at Information Technologists’ Hall on Tuesday 16 July. Thirteen new Freemen made their declarations and were admitted by the Master to the Freedom of the Worshipful Company of Nurses. Seven Freemen of the Company made their declarations and were…

The Trustees of the Company of Nurses Charitable Trust have received a detailed report from scholar, Tracy Fiddy. Tracy was granted a prestigious award by The Company of Nurses Charitable Trust Scholarship Programme in 2023. With our support, Tracy is undertaking the Masters (MSc) degree run by the Institute of Pre-Hospital Care (IoPHC), a department…

On 24 June 2024, Common Hall brought together Liverymen from all Livery Companies for the annual election of the City Sheriffs. The Master of The Worshipful Company of Nurses, Jane Carey-Harris, was honoured to lead the procession of Masters, as The City of London Corporation graciously allowed her to process as Master, being a Liveryman…

The Master, Jane Carey- Harris, and Court Assistant and Trustee, Deirdre Barr attended the City University Prize Giving on 2 July 2024. The Worshipful Company of Nurses introduced several awards in 2022. To be eligible for an award students need to demonstrate above average academic performance. There are awards for two 3rd year undergraduates who…

Two Freedom of the City of London ceremonies, arranged with the Chamberlain’s office at Guildhall, were held back-to-back on Monday 17 June 2024. The Master, Upper Warden, Court Assistant Deirdre Barr, Clerk, Assistant Clerk and guests were in attendance. A celebratory lunch was held in the Aldermen’s Dining Room at Guildhall afterwards. Being admitted to…

Emma Hammett, Liveryman of the Worshipful Company of Nurses, has been awarded the British Empire Medal (BEM) in the King’s birthday honours for her outstanding service to first aid training, accident prevention and a campaign to reduce the devasting impact of knife crime. Emma has a lifetime experience of saving lives in frontline A&E services.…

The Worshipful Company of Educators The Educators’ Trust Mental Health in Education-Inspiring Solutions In April Past Master Fran Davies and Freeman Professor Emma Wadey attended the Educators Trust Awards Dinner. The Worshipful Company of Nurses were invited to contribute to this year’s event due to the topic of mental health and were delighted to meet…

A Freedom and Livery ceremony of the Worshipful Company of Nurses was held in the Court Room at Information Technologists’ Hall on Wednesday 22 May. Two applicants were admitted to the Freedom of the Company and five Freemen made their declarations and were clothed in Livery. It was a wonderful occasion presided over by the…

The Company of Nurses Charitable Trust has received a very generous donation from The Luton and Dunstable Hospital Nurses’ League. This League has taken the decision to close following changes in nurse education, falling membership and inability to recruit new members. The affiliation of student nurses has shifted from a specific training hospital to a…

Members of the Company of Nurses attended the annual Florence Nightingale Commemorative Service at Westminster Abbey. Organised each year by the Florence Nightingale Foundation, this very moving service is important for nursing and midwifery communities worldwide. More than 2000 people in the congregation came together to give thanks and to celebrate the nurses and midwives…
